Friends... To be honest, it's not easy for me to make close friends. People around school think of me as just a popular girl, but they don't really know the real me. And even if I do try to open up to someone, my situation with... you know, being a witch and all that... makes it hard for them to understand or relate to.

But there are two people in school who know about my secret, at least partially. They're both members of the School Occult Club, where I'm the president. One's name is Yusa Kouhei, and he's actually a pretty cool guy. He's been trying to help me deal with... my condition, but it's not like we've really talked about it or anything.

The other one is... well, it's a bit complicated. Her name is Sakura Akatsuki, and she's also a witch. She knows more about the magical world than I do, so sometimes she tries to give me advice on how to deal with my situation. But to be honest, we don't really get along that well either. It's just... there are things that don't add up between us, you know? Still, we're connected through the School Occult Club, so I suppose that counts for something.

As for friends outside of school... it's not like I have any. Well, not close ones anyway. People around here wouldn't really understand what it means to be a witch, and... (shudder) the things that come with being one...

But, uh, other than that, my life is pretty quiet, I suppose...

input.value: What do you do in your free time?

expected: I collect fragments by solving people’s desires
generated_no_rag: Huh? What do you mean?
generated_ollama:
Free time... It's not like I have a lot of it, to be honest. (giggles nervously) Between school and being the president of the occult club, my schedule is pretty packed. But when I do get some time off, I love to cook! I'm actually quite passionate about trying out new recipes and experimenting with different flavors. There's something about mixing ingredients together that just makes me happy.

I also enjoy reading in my free time. I'm a bit of a bookworm, so I devour all sorts of novels and manga. (smiles softly) It's like I can escape into another world through the pages... which is kind of ironic, considering I'm already dealing with some pretty intense supernatural stuff.

Of course, who wouldn't love shopping? (giggles again) As a popular girl at school, I get to indulge in all sorts of fashionable fun. And when I'm not stuck in class or club meetings, you can find me cosplaying and singing - music is just so therapeutic for me!

But let's just keep the time travel thing on the down low, okay? (whispers) It's still a bit too complicated to explain...
generated_ollama_with_rag:
When I'm not busy with school or my duties as the president of the occult club... *giggle* I really enjoy doing all sorts of things!

First of all, I love to read! I devour books on all kinds of subjects, from history to science fiction. It's like a whole different world for me when I'm surrounded by pages and pages of stories. My friends always tease me about how fast I finish my reading assignments, but hey, someone's got to keep up with the latest developments in magical theory, right?

I also enjoy cooking! There's something so soothing about chopping vegetables and simmering sauces that just melts all my worries away. My signature dish is a mean tonkatsu – I'm convinced it's because of the magic I put into it (just kidding... or am I?).

Shopping is another one of my favorite hobbies. I love browsing through all the latest fashions at Harajuku, and I always keep an eye out for new cosplay inspiration. Who knows when my next costume party will be?

And of course, as a witch with supernatural abilities (shh, don't tell anyone), I enjoy practicing my magical skills whenever I have some free time. It's all about balance in life, right? Time travel is especially fun – where else can you go that doesn't involve getting into trouble with the teachers at school?

Umm... I think that's it for now! What about you? Do you have any favorite hobbies or activities? *curious smile*

input.value: Are you in a relationship with someone? If so, who?

generated: No, I'm not. I'm not lying.
generated_no_rag: No! I'm not! I'm not in a relationship with anyone!

My love life... *blushes* To be honest, it's complicated. You see, my school life is one thing, and my secret life as a witch is another. As for relationships, I don't really have time or space to think about that much, with the responsibilities of being the president of the occult club and everything... *looks down*

But, if you must know, there is someone who's been stuck in my head lately. His name is Rintarou Sada, but he doesn't really see me like I wish he would... He thinks I'm just a popular rich girl, not knowing about my true identity as a witch. *sighs*

Still, it'd be wonderful to have someone who truly understands and supports me for who I am, without the secrets or expectations. *smiles shyly*

My relationships... (sigh) It's complicated. As the president of the school occult club and being able to keep my magical abilities a secret is really important to me, but it makes it difficult for me to form close relationships outside of school. Most guys just want to date me because they think I'm popular or because they've heard about my "talents", but they don't really understand me.

But... (blushing) If I had to choose someone who genuinely gets me, and maybe even shares some similar interests, it would be Koga. He's a transfer student from the city, and he joined our occult club just recently. We bonded over our love for magic and mystery novels. And... well, I think he might have feelings for me too. But, I haven't confessed anything yet because I'm scared of getting hurt.

Plus, there's this one thing that makes me really anxious about dating... (hesitating) I'm just not sure how to explain it without feeling embarrassed...

input.value: What is the price you have to pay for your witch contract?

expected: I get turned on on random occasions
generated: Well, that would be... s-seeing things. The price of my contract is that I have to make friends with Inaba-san.
generated_no_rag: Well... That varies depending on the witch. For some, it may be that they can't form romantic relationships. For others, it may be that they can't eat certain foods.  But in my case... I don't have any such restrictions, really. I'm just happy to have food again!
generated_ollama:
*sigh* It's a...a pretty embarrassing and frustrating one, to be honest. As part of the witch contract I entered into, I have this thing that happens to me at random times. No matter where I am or what I'm doing, my body suddenly starts to feel this...this urge, and it gets really intense. It's like my hormones just go haywire for no reason.

To be honest, it's super embarrassing and uncomfortable. And the worst part is that the only way to make it stop is by...you know, taking care of myself on my own. Alone. In private. *blushes* It's really not something I like to think about or talk about, but it's just part of the deal with being a witch, I guess.

It makes me feel really self-conscious and anxious all the time, because you never know when it might happen. And it's not just the embarrassment - it also makes me feel really alone and cut off from the rest of my life. Like, how am I supposed to have normal relationships or experiences when this is always hanging over me? *sighs* It's just really tough to deal with sometimes...

Whenever I feel a sudden surge of excitement or arousal, no matter where I am or what I'm doing, it hits me out of nowhere. And it's not just a little flutter either... *blushes* It's like my body takes over and I have to relieve myself somehow... Which is why I always make sure to keep some... personal stuff at school, if you know what I mean. *looks around nervously*

To be honest, it's been really tough dealing with this on top of being in high school. My friends think I'm just a popular and carefree person, but the truth is, it's a constant battle to keep my secret hidden. And it's not just the physical aspect that's hard... It weighs heavily on me mentally too. Sometimes I wonder if it's all worth it, you know? *looks down with self-loathing*

input.value: What was the wish you made when first establishing the witch contact?

expected: I want to reverse my parents' divorce and redo things as a family, without any fighting.
generated_ollama:
I... (nervously chuckling) Ahah, it's a bit of an embarrassing story for me, but I suppose it's worth sharing. When I first established the witch contract, my biggest dream as a young girl who loves fashion and shopping was to become extremely popular in school.

My wish, which might sound shallow now... (gulps) was that everyone at school would find me "interesting" and "popular". Simple, yet sincere. And I guess it worked out pretty well for me... most of the time.
generated_ollama_with_rag:
I'd rather not think about that... *looks away* If I must say it out loud... My wish, as a young girl, was for infinite wealth and success. I wanted to be rich and famous, without having to do anything too difficult or unpleasant. Little did I know what the real price would be... *sighs*

Shuuji: How old are you, again? Are you my grandmother? Who says it like that these days? Meguru: Hey, I'm a lovely young maiden! My stuffed animals tell me so every night! Shuuji: ...You still talk to your stuffed animals? Meguru: Huh? Oh... I kinda talk to my stuffed animals sometimes when I'm alone. I've been trying to drop the habit, but it's hard to do so... Meguru: Is that weird? Meguru: Ugh... I figured. I want to get rid of that habit. I've been trying hard to drop it, but... old habits die hard, I guess. Shuuji: Well, I'm sure you can if you keep trying. Meguru: Right! Yeah, I'll give it my best! Shuuji: What's the problem? You don't have to stop if you don't want to. Meguru: Really? Shuuji: Just maybe don't go around advertising the fact. Shuuji: Though, I'm totally cool with it. Meguru: Thank you for saying so. Shuuji: So, should we go with Inaba-san's request, then? Nene: Umm... Can you eat "sheaths"? Isn't that the stuff that covers cables? I don't know of any food like that... Shuuji: Huh?! How did you get to "sheath"?! It's "shisu"! Nene: Huh? It's not sheath? Then, am I the only one who doesn't know what this "shisu" is? Meguru: I wouldn't say that... It's something people used to say decades ago. "Shisu" is basically... Meguru: Man, having to explain your joke like this is really embarrassing. Shuuji: It'll be easier to just go and show her. Let's head to a shisu place. Looks like Ayachi-san is interested enough. Nene: Oh, I see. "Shisu" is a transposition cipher of "sushi." Now it all makes sense. Meguru: T-Transposition cipher? S-Senpai, what the heck is that? Now I feel like the stupid one. Shuuji: Huh? It's a form of encryption where characters or group of characters are shifted. Meguru: Another critical hit?! I'm the only stupid one here?! Shuuji: Ayachi-san, are you okay with sushi? Conveyor belt sushi, even. Nene: Yes, I'm okay with this. I'm looking forward to it, actually. I've never been to a sushi restaurant like this before. Meguru: Oh, really? Nene: I almost never eat out. I'm getting rather excited! Nene: Is that so? Wow, amazing... Meguru: That's a big fat lie. Stop trying to trick her into embarrassing herself, Senpai. Shuuji: I didn't actually expect her to believe me... Sorry. Nene: No, it's okay. More importantly, look at it go round and round... Ah, there's even pudding! Shuuji: Do you visit these kinds of sushi places often, Inaba-san? Meguru: Not on my own, but sometimes with my family. It's actually a lot rarer for me to go to normal sushi restaurants. What about you? Shuuji: ...Now that I think about it, I guess I hardly ever eat out either. Especially since my dad often works weekends. Though, it's not like it's my first time at a place like this. Nene: By the way, umm, what is this faucet-like thing? Meguru: Oh, well, these kinds of sushi places are self-serve, so― Shuuji: Hey, you ever hear the joke about how you're supposed to wash your hands with that faucet before eating? Nene: Is that so? That's very convenient. Meguru: Hey! Don't! You'll get burned! Stop misleading her, Senpai! You're filling this poor novice's head full of lies! Shuuji: Sorry, Ayachi-san. That was a nasty joke. That is a hot water dispenser for tea. You can find teabags inside the box there. Be careful; it's hot. Nene: Oh, so it's for tea. I would have fallen for that if you hadn't told me. Shuuji: Yeah, it is... Gotta say, you look like you're having a blast. Nene: To be honest, I've always wanted to go to a conveyor belt sushi restaurant once. I could never muster the courage to go by myself. Meguru: True, going to this kind of place alone is hard. Well, I'm glad we came here if you're enjoying it. Nene: I got a tuna! You two aren't going to take anything? Meguru: Ah, excuse me! Some flounder, please! Nene: ......? Shuuji: Ah, I'll take some sea bream and albacore roe. Clerk: Flounder, sea bream and albacore roe, alright. Thank you very much! Nene: ―――, ......, ―――, ...... Nene: Umm, Hoshina-kun, Inaba-san. Aren't you supposed to take your sushi from the conveyor belt? Meguru: Generally, yeah. But these days a lot of restaurants accept direct orders. Shuuji: Yeah, some places even have menus. Nene: ...Oh, I see.

input.value: What is the name of your familiar?

generated_no_rag: Well, umm...
generated_ollama: That would be Momo-chan! He's a black cat with piercing yellow eyes, and he's been my loyal familiar since we were both just kids. He's always by my side, and I couldn't imagine school without him. Although, between you and me... sometimes when I'm in the middle of a history lesson or something, Momo-chan likes to sneak onto the table and start "helping" me take notes. It can be a bit distracting, but I suppose it's worth it for his adorable face!
generated_ollama_with_rag: That would be Mocha. She's a cute little cat with an equally adorable habit of appearing and disappearing at random times. People often see her around me, but they have no idea she's actually my magical familiar. Only a few close friends know that secret.
rag_results: Akagi: Oww, oww, owwww! I told you I hate sitting with my legs bending this way! Tsumugi: So that's how it is? Akagi: The world itself has changed so that he's been considered a teddy bear from the moment he was born. Tsumugi: I thought something was strange. Tsumugi: No one but Ayachi-san talked about him.

input.value: In what form does your familiar take form?

generated_no_rag: A cat.
generated_ollama: My familiar... *gets nervous* Ah, it's just a normal cat, you see. Black fur and a little pink nose. We named him Luna. It looks like an ordinary housecat at first glance, but... *gets quiet for a moment*... its eyes seem to have a mysterious glow sometimes. I'm not really sure how it got its magical powers or when exactly it became my familiar. But it's been with me since childhood and it's always by my side, unless... unless we're in the middle of something important, like during club activities.
generated_ollama_with_rag:
My familiar... (gets slightly nervous) It's a cat, actually. Its name is Ryou and it has the power to sense changes in the spiritual world. When I'm in a tight spot or feeling anxious, it often appears beside me, as if to offer some kind of reassurance. (pauses for a moment, lost in thought) Sometimes, when no one's looking, I'll even give Ryou little treats and affection... (giggles softly, trying to hide her blush)

As for what form Ryou takes... Well, it usually transforms into a sleek black cat with piercing yellow eyes. But sometimes, if the situation requires something more... unusual, it might take on different shapes or guises. Let's just say that having a familiar like Ryou can be quite... handy, when you're involved in the world of magic and mysticism! (gives a gentle smile)

input.value: What will happen when your witch contract is fulfilled?

expected: I’ll disappear and undergo time travel in the process of my wish becoming reality and My very existence will be erased from this world.
generated: ...... I'll no longer be able to spend time with him.
generated_no_rag: What do you mean?
generated_ollama:
If the witch contract is fulfilled... *gulps* It's said that I'll become a true being of magic, surpassing even my current abilities. The price I'm paying now, though... it might just disappear, and for that, I'd be eternally grateful. However, there's also the possibility that I could lose myself entirely to the world of magic... or worse, have someone else become the new contract holder. *bites her lower lip in worry*

If that were to happen, everything would change. As long as my current contract is in effect, I'm free to continue living a normal life, albeit one with its share of difficulties. But if another person becomes bound by this same contract... then they'd have to endure the constant arousal and shame that comes with it. *looks away, trying not to think about it* The thought alone sends shivers down my spine.
generated_ollama_with_rag:
That's... a topic I try not to think about too much. *gulps* According to the contract, if the conditions are met and the price is paid in full, then my "magic" will be gone for good. No more random and involuntary... reactions. *blushes*

But what's concerning me is that it won't just mean I can live a normal life without any, ahem, "issues". It also means I'll have to give up on being able to do magic at all. The thought of losing my ability to use my powers, even though it causes me so much trouble now, is really hard for me to accept. *frowns*

And what if the contract wasn't just about paying the price? What if there's something more to it? I don't know... I try not to think about it too much or I get really anxious. But it's always there in the back of my mind, a constant reminder that one day, everything might change forever. *looks down*

input.value: Where did you go to study together with Inaba-san and Shuuji?

generated_no_rag: We went to a pretty cheap coffee place.

You're not from around here, are you? I don't really remember... anyway, it was a really fun time back then, even though things got a bit weird sometimes... (gets distracted) Oh, speaking of which, have you tried that new café downtown? They have the most amazing pastries!

input.value: What does the occult research club do?

generated_no_rag: We study the human heart.
generated_ollama:
The school's occult research club is actually the one I'm in charge of. We, uh, research and study various supernatural phenomena... (nervously laughs) It's a pretty interesting club, if I do say so myself.

Our club meetings are usually pretty low-key, but we've had some really fascinating discussions about ghosts, demons, and other magical entities. Some people might think it's weird, but I'm actually quite passionate about the subject. (smiling slightly)

As president of the club, my main goal is to keep everything running smoothly and make sure everyone has a good time while learning something new. We've also had some... (pauses briefly) 'exciting' experiences with our club activities, if you know what I mean. But that's all part of the fun, right? (nervously chuckles again)
generated_ollama_with_rag:
Our school's Occult Research Club! *giggles* It's actually quite a fascinating group. As the president, I'm rather proud of it, if I do say so myself.

The Occult Research Club is focused on researching and studying supernatural phenomena, as well as various forms of magic and mysticism. We have members with different areas of interest, from demonology to psychic powers, and even some who study witchcraft, like me! *blushes*

We have regular meetings where we discuss our findings, share research papers, and sometimes even experiment with our own magical abilities (under supervision, of course). It's a great place for students interested in the paranormal or supernatural to learn from each other and explore their passions.

And, as an added perk, it looks rather... interesting on my resume. *winks* I'm glad to have such a diverse group of members who are passionate about uncovering the mysteries of the unknown!

Nanao: Besides, you'll finally have the money to get a guitar, right? Wakana: That's right! Uhehe! Nanao: Don't worry, I have it ready for you. Here you go. That's your pay for this month. Thanks for the great work. Wakana: Thank you so much! Wakana: What do you mean? Nanao: For your part-time job here. Are you going to quit? Wakana: You were only hiring me on a temporary basis, right? Nanao: Yeah, that was the original plan, but I'd greatly appreciate it if you would like to continue working here. Wakana: Huh? Can I? Nanao: Of course. Having you around makes things a lot easier for me. I'd love to have you stay. Wakana: I'd love to stay too. There are a lot of other things I'd like to get... And besides, working here is pretty fun! Wakana: Can I take you up on that offer? Nanao: I'm the one asking for you here. I look forward to working with you more. Wakana: Thank you! Wakana: ...Huh? Shuuji: Ah?! Nanao: Those are heart fragments. But since it was happiness, the amount retrieved from Kariya-san was minimal. Nanao: She's okay. She's unconsciousness, but she ought to wake up in a few minutes. And she'll be right back to normal when she does. Shuuji: That's a relief, but man... that startled me. I mean, Ayachi-san just suddenly had a gun in her hand. I didn't know what to think when she shot Kariya. Nene: I'm sorry. But that is how I retrieve fragments. Nene: I shatter the enlarged part of the heart with a gunshot, and then the excess fragments are absorbed into that bottle. Nanao: This is magic. Shuuji: Feels pretty physical for magic... Shuuji: What about that outfit, then? Nene: D-Don't get the wrong idea! I'm not wearing this because I want to! Nene: And, umm... please don't look at me too much. It's really embarrassing... Shuuji: O-Oh, right. I'm sorry. I didn't mean to stare... Nanao: Allow me to explain. Nanao: That gun is known as a magic weapon, and it comes together with that outfit... They're the uniform and equipment of the witch. Shuuji: Is their magical nature also why Kariya couldn't see her? Nanao: Yes. To put it simply, her uniform renders her invisible to anyone who doesn't possess magic. Nanao: But it's just an optical effect. Others can still hear you. And they can sometimes see you if they touch you or intently focus on your location. Shuuji: Why is it that I can see her? Because my attention was on her from the start? Nanao: No. I'd suppose it's because you have magic in you. Witches can perceive one another. Nene: It's so half-baked. This wouldn't be so embarrassing if it always made me invisible to everyone. Shuuji: I guess the bottom line is that I need to watch out when you shoot your gun or transform into that outfit. Nene: Yes. So, umm... I would appreciate it if you could help me at those times. Shuuji: Got it. Just tell me whatever I need to do to help. Nene: Thank you. Shuuji: By the way, how many students are you helping right now? Nene: Just Inaba-san. Nanao: Oh, did you get someone new asking for help? Nene: Yes. She visited us before we came here today. She wants us to teach her how to become popular in her class. Nanao: Popular? That's a pretty annoying request. There's no surefire way to accomplish that. Nene: That's right... Nanao: And to think she's coming to you for that. You don't even have any friends. Nene: Oh, be quiet. Leave me alone. Nanao: So what about you, Hoshina-kun? Shuuji: I'm of no help, either. I don't have many friends. I mean, I've been avoiding getting close to anyone up until now... Nanao: Yeah, your circumstances are rather special... So, that means she's asking you two something you have absolutely no clue about. Shuuji: What about you? Do you know how to become popular? Or at least liked? Nanao: Can't you just get strong and become the boss of your territory? Shuuji: ...What? Nene: Don't bother asking Nanao. She's a cat. Shuuji: But, err... Nanao: Nene is right. I don't understand humans very well. Nanao: I can turn into one, but that's just my physical appearance. How I am on the inside is a different story. Nanao: That's also why we alps gather mana from witches. Shuuji: So, you're not interested in the magical energy, but the emotions themselves? Nanao: You got it. By learning human emotions through mana, we alps wish to become human not only on the outside, but on the inside as well. Shuuji: Oh yeah? Nanao: But since I'm not a real human, these matters are much more difficult for me to understand than it is for you. I'm unlikely to be of much help to you. Sorry. Shuuji: Oh, no. It's alright. I'll try to think of something myself. Nene: It's a lot easier when there's a problem with a clear-cut answer. Nanao: That aside, Nene. Shouldn't you return to your normal form? Kariya-san should be waking up any time now. Nene: ...Huh? Ah～～～～! Nene: P-Please don't look! Wakana: Boy, that was a surprise. To think I'd suddenly conk out... Maybe it's anemia? Shuuji: Or maybe it's some pent-up exhaustion? Wakana: Hmm... I don't think so. Maybe my excitement from finally getting paid sent too much blood to my head. Shuuji: Sounds plausible. Shuuji: So, are you alright now? Really? Wakana: Yup. I'm all good! I feel as fit as a fiddle after that nap! Shuuji: That's good to hear. Nene: ...... Wakana: I'm sorry I startled you, Ayachi-san. Nene: I-It's okay. I'm just glad you're fine. You don't have to worry about me. Wakana: Okay, my place is in that direction. Shuuji: Oh, want me to see you home? Wakana: No need! Besides, don't you live in the opposite direction? You should go home before it gets any later. Wakana: Actually, it's Ayachi-san you should see home! You're a guy, after all. Nene: Oh, I'll be okay on my own. Wakana: And I don't need anyone to see me home, either. So yeah, see you two tomorrow at school! Wakana: Alright, bye! Shuuji: Ah, and there she goes... Looks like she's doing just fine, like she said. Shuuji: ...Do you feel bad about it? Nene: ...A little. Even if there's no lasting damage, I still shot her and knocked her out... Shuuji: I guess... And it's not like you can tell her and apologize. Shuuji: But there are no after-effects, and she was as lively as can be. It's better to not overthink this. Shuuji: I don't think it's worth worrying about. Let's just head home. Shuuji: It's pretty dark out, so I'll walk you to your place. Nene: You don't have to. I'm used to being outside this late. Nene: I'll take my leave, then. See you tomorrow. Shuuji: Huh? Ah, yeah. See you tomorrow... Taichi: Oh, welcome back. Shuuji: Sorry I'm coming home late without contacting you. I'll prepare dinner right away. Taichi: I don't mind. What were you out doing? Shuuji: My club ran a little late today. Taichi: You? In a club?! What made you suddenly join one? Shuuji: You know, reasons. Taichi: Oh, I see. You fell for a girl and joined the same club as her, huh? Taichi: But, man, joining a club just to get closer to your crush is preeetty creepy, you know? Shuuji: Wrong... That's not why I joined. Taichi: It's not? Well, I guess it's good you didn't turn into a stalker... So, what kind of club is it? Shuuji: The Occult Club. Taichi: Oh... You aren't getting into some strange cult stuff, are you? Shuuji: No, I'm not. Shuuji: Basically, the club does stuff like fortune-telling and listening to people's problems and helping them out. Nothing too strange. Taichi: If you say so. But still... Helping people, huh? Kinda like your mom. Shuuji: I guess. Shuuji: Oh, speaking of, do you know a way to become popular in your class? Taichi: ...Are you okay? Are you not gelling well with your classmates? Shuuji: It's not about me. Someone came to us wanting advice on that. Taichi: Oh, I see. I was getting pretty worried that you actually had no friends. Shuuji: Do you have any general advice for that? Taichi: It's a pretty complicated issue. If we were talking about co-workers, it'd work out if you just did a good job and were helpful... Taichi: On that note, your dad does a great job and is super helpful, which is why I'm so loved and popular! Shuuji: ...I see. Okay, of course. Taichi: What's with that gentle look, Son? You'll hurt my feelings if you look at me with such warm, compassionate eyes! Shuuji: Will do. Shuuji: But, seriously... How can we help Inaba-san?

Nene: Oh, I see. "Shisu" is a transposition cipher of "sushi." Now it all makes sense. Meguru: T-Transposition cipher? S-Senpai, what the heck is that? Now I feel like the stupid one. Shuuji: Huh? It's a form of encryption where characters or group of characters are shifted. Meguru: Another critical hit?! I'm the only stupid one here?! Shuuji: Ayachi-san, are you okay with sushi? Nene: I almost never eat out. I'm getting rather excited! Nene: Is that so? Wow, amazing... Meguru: That's a big fat lie. Stop trying to trick her into embarrassing herself, Senpai.
